meanings.sent1: She loves to whirl around in circles.
meanings.sent2: The dancer will whirl gracefully on stage.
meanings.sent3: The children whirl with joy at the playground.
meanings.sent4: Time seems to whirl by when you're having fun.
meanings.sent5: The tornado will whirl destructively through the town.

meanings.definition: A rapid circular movement or spin
meanings.sent1: The whirl of the carousel made her dizzy.
meanings.sent2: I watched the whirl of the spinning top.
meanings.sent3: The whirl of the fan kept the room cool.
meanings.sent4: The whirl of colors in the painting was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The whirl of emotions in her heart was overwhelming.
